page.title: 04Plants and Animals
page.content: A lady who lives by the river owns a piece of land which she is trying to turn into a small nature reserve. It is already full of weeds nettles and ferns but she clears spaces and introduces wild flowers. There are other local people who are interested and they have been cleaning up litter and spreading wild flowers seeds for the future. Along the old railway line there are lots of wild flowers, especially at the beginning of the summer. In the woods near Cragside there are roe and fallow deer which can often be seen crossing the road but they are not tame. In the woods there are red squirrels but on the moorland you need to be careful because there are adders.
